Setup an OpenSim Static Optimization Analysis

Source: R/setup_static_optimisation_osim.R
setup_static_optimisation_osim.Rd

This function sets up an OpenSim Static Optimization analysis using the OpenSim Python API (via `reticulate`). It creates and configures an `AnalyzeTool` object with a `StaticOptimization` analysis and optionally writes the setup file to XML or returns the configured tool object.

Usage

setup_static_optimisation_osim(
  model_file = "model_scaled.osim",
  replace_force_set = FALSE,
  force_set_file = "reserve_actuators.xml",
  results_directory = ".",
  output_precision = 12L,
  start_time = 0,
  end_time = 3,
  solve_for_equilibrium_for_auxiliary_states = FALSE,
  maximum_number_of_integrator_steps = 20000L,
  maximum_integrator_step_size = 1,
  minimum_integrator_step_size = 1e-08,
  integrator_error_tolerance = 1e-05,
  coordinates_file = NULL,
  use_model_force_set = TRUE,
  activation_exponent = 2,
  use_muscle_physiology = TRUE,
  in_degrees = TRUE,
  external_loads_file = "external_loads.xml",
  step_interval = 1L,
  lowpass_cutoff_frequency_for_coordinates,
  setup_filename = "setup_so.xml",
  write_file = FALSE,
  return_object = TRUE
)

Arguments

model_file

Character. Path to the scaled OpenSim model file (default: `"model_scaled.osim"`).

replace_force_set

Logical. Whether to replace the model's existing force set (default: `FALSE`).

force_set_file

Character. Path to the force set XML file (default: `"reserve_actuators.xml"`).

results_directory

Character. Directory where results will be written (default: `"."`).

output_precision

Integer. Output precision for numerical results (default: `12L`).

start_time

Numeric. Start time for the analysis (default: `0`).

end_time

Numeric. End time for the analysis (default: `3`).

solve_for_equilibrium_for_auxiliary_states

Logical. Whether to solve for equilibrium of auxiliary states (default: `FALSE`).

maximum_number_of_integrator_steps

Integer. Maximum number of integrator steps (default: `20000L`).

maximum_integrator_step_size

Numeric. Maximum integrator step size (default: `1`).

minimum_integrator_step_size

Numeric. Minimum integrator step size (default: `1e-8`).

integrator_error_tolerance

Numeric. Integrator error tolerance (default: `1e-5`).

coordinates_file

Character or `NULL`. Path to a motion (coordinates) file (default: `NULL`).

use_model_force_set

Logical. Whether to use the model's own force set in static optimization (default: `TRUE`).

activation_exponent

Numeric. Activation exponent for optimization (default: `2`).

use_muscle_physiology

Logical. Whether to use muscle physiology in optimization (default: `TRUE`).

in_degrees

Logical. Whether coordinate data is in degrees (default: `TRUE`).

external_loads_file

Character. Path to external loads file (default: `"external_loads.xml"`).

step_interval

Integer. Step interval for optimization (default: `1L`).

lowpass_cutoff_frequency_for_coordinates

Numeric. Low-pass filter cutoff frequency for coordinate data (required).

setup_filename

Character. Name of the XML setup file to write (default: `"setup_so.xml"`).

write_file

Logical. Whether to write the setup XML file (default: `FALSE`).

return_object

Logical. Whether to return the configured `AnalyzeTool` object (default: `TRUE`).

Value

If `return_object = TRUE`, returns an OpenSim `AnalyzeTool` object. Otherwise, invisibly returns `NULL`.

Details

This helper function is designed to simplify the setup of Static Optimization analyses in OpenSim. It builds and configures the `AnalyzeTool`, optionally adds the `StaticOptimization` analysis, and can write the configuration to XML for use in OpenSim GUI or scripts.
